intro: Warreopsis parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered warreopsis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Warreopsis parviflora is often found in forest understories and thrives in humid, shaded environments.
